did.unittitle: Gaess Outdoor Advertising photographs 1950s-1960s and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Gaess Outdoor was a family-owned outdoor advertising company founded in the 1930s in northern New Jersey, serving the New Jersey-Metropolitan New York market. It was acquired in 1997 by Universal Outdoor, a subsidiary of Clear Channel Communications, Inc. The Gaess Outdoor Advertising Photographs collection spans the decades of the 1950s and 1960s and includes black-and-white photographs and negatives of painted and blank billboard structures, locations, proposed locations and competitors' billboards. Clients include Budweiser (Anheuser-Busch), Cities Service (Citgo), Gulf Oil, Schaefer and Schlitz. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, researchers are requested to limit access requests to the photographs. Access to negatives will be permitted only upon consultation with a reference archivist.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Gaess Outdoor Advertising Photographs, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Gaess Outdoor Advertising Photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2008.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Alexandra Gebhard and Richard Collier, February 2011
Accession 2008-0124 is described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Gaess Outdoor was founded in the 1930s by "Billy Goat" Gaess, a sign and rock painter in Palisades, N.J. Headquarters later moved to Montvale, N.J. The company maintained billboard structures in northern New Jersey and Westchester County, N.Y., and produced printed and painted billboards as well as electrical spectaculars. It remained a family-owned business until around 1988, when it was purchased by James McAndrew, who operated the company until it was sold to Universal Outdoor, a subsidiary of Clear Channel Communications, in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Gaess Outdoor Advertising Photographs collection spans the decades of the 1950s and 1960s and includes black-and-white photographs and negatives of painted and blank billboard structures, locations, proposed locations and competitors' billboards. Clients include Budweiser (Anheuser-Busch), Cities Service, Gulf Oil, Schaefer and Schlitz.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two series: Photographs and Negatives, alphabetically therein. Categories--Advertisers, Dead Files (former clients), Locations, Proposed Locations, Competitors--reflect the original arrangement scheme of the photographs. Photographs and negatives were separated for preservation purposes. Original folder titles were retained where possible.

accessrestrict.p: Restriction on Access: Researchers are requested to limit access requests to the photographs. Access to negatives will be permitted only upon consultation with a reference archivist.
